Mr. Speaker, I rise in support of the Reversionary Interest  Conveyance Act, introduced by my colleague from California,  Representative Matsui.

This legislation would authorize the conveyance of certain  reversionary interests…

…Maryland's consent might be required under the foregoing       provision of the Admissions Clause. This objection mistakenly       presupposes that Maryland retains a reversionary interest in       the territory currently composing the District of Columbia,       which Maryland ceded to the federal government when the       District was established…

(B) impose any obligation, term, or condition on SCF       relating to that property; or

(C) allow for any reversionary interest of the United       States in that property.

(b) Effect on Any Quitclaim Deed.--The conveyance by the       Secretary under subsection (a) of section 3 by warranty…

Mr. WESTERMAN. Mr. Speaker, I move to suspend the rules and pass the  bill (H.R. 952) to convey the reversionary interest of the United  States in certain land in Sacramento, California.

The Clerk read the title of the bill.
